summary: This document contains email exchanges between Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell from 2009 and 2015. The 2009 emails discuss legal concerns about being served with a subpoena and strategies to avoid testifying. The 2015 email shows Epstein encouraging Maxwell to maintain a public presence and mentions a Swedish ambassador who dismisses the seriousness of the allegations against them.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Communicates with Ghislaine Maxwell about legal strategy regarding a subpoena in 2009, and in 2015 encourages her to act normally and mentions a Swedish ambassador who downplays allegations.

persons.name: Gmax
persons.context: Corresponds with Jeffrey Epstein, expressing concern about being served with a subpoena in 2009 and discussing her relationship timeline with him in 2015.

persons.name: Lisa Svenson
persons.context: Mentioned by Epstein as having stated that no one on her ocean panel takes the allegations against Maxwell seriously and that Maxwell would be welcome at ocean conferences.

connections.description: Email correspondence discussing legal strategies to avoid testifying and coordinating public response to allegations.
Epstein mentions having Lisa Svenson over and relays her dismissive attitude toward allegations against Maxwell.
Epstein suggests Maxwell would be welcome at conferences attended by Svenson's panel, indicating a connection through social/political circles.

events.title: Attempted service of subpoena
events.description: A person came to Maxwell's house attempting to serve her with a subpoena related to a lawsuit involving her and a Jane Doe.

events.title: Legal strategy discussion
events.description: Epstein advises Maxwell they can file a protective order to prevent her from having to testify, comparing it to a harassment lawsuit.

events.title: Maxwell's relationship timeline
events.description: Maxwell states her relationship with Epstein was from end of 1999 to 2002.

events.title: Epstein's encouragement to Maxwell
events.description: Epstein urges Maxwell to act normally, go to parties, and mentions Lisa Svenson's dismissive attitude toward allegations.

keyFacts: In 2009, Ghislaine Maxwell was concerned about being served with a subpoena related to a lawsuit involving her and a Jane Doe.
Jeffrey Epstein advised Maxwell on legal strategy to avoid testifying, suggesting filing a protective order claiming she was not near the person during relevant dates.
In 2015, Epstein encouraged Maxwell to maintain a public presence, stating she had 'done nothing wrong' and should not act like an 'escaping convict.'
Epstein mentioned Swedish ocean ambassador Lisa Svenson, who reportedly said no one on her ocean panel takes the allegations against Maxwell seriously.
Maxwell stated her relationship with Epstein lasted from the end of 1999 to 2002.
